paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a TTR gene variant associated with familial amyloid polyneuropathy, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: sixth and seventh decades of life, specific ages not provided
patients.phenotype: systemic amyloidosis presenting as peripheral neuropathy

individual_records.phenotype_details: systemic amyloidosis presenting as peripheral neuropathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: We report a new kindred with systemic amyloidosis presenting as peripheral neuropathy in the sixth and seventh decades of life.

functional_data.summary: The TTR molecules which have no cysteine have a unique structure in heterozygous TTR polymers and are responsible for amyloid fibril formation.
assays: restriction fragment length polymorphism analysis by polymerase chain reaction

variants.segregation_data: It is hypothesised that the variant is responsible for disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: The variant was identified in a kindred with systemic amyloidosis.
key_quotes: It is hypothesised that the TTR molecules which have no cysteine have a unique structure in heterozygous TTR polymers and are responsible for amyloid fibril formation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
